version_description:
• Fixed issue that could stop Facebook spoken comments.
• Fixed issue that could cause iCloud duplicate databases.
• Added new setting: More > Settings > Advanced > Ascent / Descent Tolerance.
• Other bug fixes and improvements.

• Fixed issue that could stop Facebook spoken comments.
• Fixed issue that could cause iCloud duplicate databases.
• Added new setting: More > Settings > Advanced > Ascent / Descent Tolerance.
• Other bug fixes and improvements.

• Added Wheel Speed to list of configurable graphs for speed sensor users.
• Further speed sensor improvements for responsiveness and stop detection.
• Other bug fixes and improvements. Recommended for all users.

• Added Wheel Speed to list of configurable graphs for speed sensor users.
• Further speed sensor improvements for responsiveness and stop detection.
• Other bug fixes and improvements. Recommended for all users.

Updated for iOS 9 and watchOS 2!

Apple Watch:
• Updated for watchOS 2, running natively on Apple Watch for improved responsiveness.
• Just start & stop directly from Apple Watch. No need to open the app on iPhone first.
• Includes haptic feedback on Start, Stop, and Lap.
• Bug fixes and other improvements.
• Note: No longer supports watchOS 1. watchOS 2 and iOS 9 required to use Apple Watch.

iPhone, iPad:
• Updated for iOS 9.
• Now uses San Francisco font.
• Uses ATS & HTTPS for improved security.
• Opens Workout Explorer directly in Safari.
• Updated sensor support library.
• Bug fixes and other improvements.

Updated for iOS 9 and watchOS 2!

Apple Watch:
• Updated for watchOS 2, running natively on Apple Watch for improved responsiveness.
• Just start & stop directly from Apple Watch. No need to open the app on iPhone first.
• Includes haptic feedback on Start, Stop, and Lap.
• Bug fixes and other improvements.
• Note: No longer supports watchOS 1. watchOS 2 and iOS 9 required to use Apple Watch.

iPhone, iPad:
• Updated for iOS 9.
• Now uses San Francisco font.
• Uses ATS & HTTPS for improved security.
• Opens Workout Explorer directly in Safari.
• Updated sensor support library.
• Bug fixes and other improvements.

Apple Watch:
• Displays and records your heart rate with Apple Watch during your workouts.

iPhone, iPad:
• Bug fixes.

Apple Watch Tips:
- Heart rate is off by default. Turn on with your iPhone at More > Apple Watch > Heart Rate from Apple Watch.
- For best accuracy, make sure the Apple Watch is tight on your wrist.
- Use of the heart rate monitor requires Apple Health access.
- The heart rate monitor is only enabled while recording a workout started from our Apple Watch app.
- Heart rate data is only transferred to your iPhone when our watch app is open.
- Leave the watch app open briefly at the end of your workout to let any data transfer complete.
- Target heart rate alerts are not supported with Apple Watch.
- If you stop the workout using your iPhone, make sure the heart rate monitor (green light) is turned off after you complete your workout by viewing our app on Apple Watch.

Apple Watch:
• Displays and records your heart rate with Apple Watch during your workouts.

iPhone, iPad:
• Bug fixes.

Apple Watch Tips:
- Heart rate is off by default. Turn on with your iPhone at More > Apple Watch > Heart Rate from Apple Watch.
- For best accuracy, make sure the Apple Watch is tight on your wrist.
- Use of the heart rate monitor requires Apple Health access.
- The heart rate monitor is only enabled while recording a workout started from our Apple Watch app.
- Heart rate data is only transferred to your iPhone when our watch app is open.
- Leave the watch app open briefly at the end of your workout to let any data transfer complete.
- Target heart rate alerts are not supported with Apple Watch.
- If you stop the workout using your iPhone, make sure the heart rate monitor (green light) is turned off after you complete your workout by viewing our app on Apple Watch.

• Improved Apple Watch app to better handle connectivity issues.
• Updated to use the most recent Google Maps library.
• Fixed issue with exports and speed sensor failure.
• Fixed issue with Power Intensity, Power Score, and power zones.
• Fixed issue with Apple Watch calorie calculations.
• Fixed issue with Nordic Walk activity.
• Other bug fixes and performance improvements.

• Improved Apple Watch app to better handle connectivity issues.
• Updated to use the most recent Google Maps library.
• Fixed issue with exports and speed sensor failure.
• Fixed issue with Power Intensity, Power Score, and power zones.
• Fixed issue with Apple Watch calorie calculations.
• Fixed issue with Nordic Walk activity.
• Other bug fixes and performance improvements.

Many improvements and fixes in this update, all based on feedback from our users. Thanks!

• Improved export to TCX, FIT, GPX, and CSV for sensor data. We now unify all time-based data sources, like GPS, HR, speed, cadence, power, and steps, which should lead to higher fidelity and improved reliability when sensors are being unreliable.
• Improved installation of RPM Speed and RPM Cadence sensors.
• Improved speed sensor failover to GPS.
• Added Lap on Stop advanced setting, which causes a lap to be recorded on every manual stop. Turn it on to see markers for every time you tapped Stop on that workout.
• Improved reliability of Apple Watch app during connectivity interruptions.
• Updated online Workout Explorer so that elevation graph is no longer zero-based, and added distance and time to scrubbing display.
• Fixed issue in zone calculation affecting zone averages.
• Fixed issue with step cadence announcement in Japanese.
• Fixed issue with More > Pedometer sometimes being off by a day.
• Other bug fixes and improvements. Recommended for all users.

Many improvements and fixes in this update, all based on feedback from our users. Thanks!

• Improved export to TCX, FIT, GPX, and CSV for sensor data. We now unify all time-based data sources, like GPS, HR, speed, cadence, power, and steps, which should lead to higher fidelity and improved reliability when sensors are being unreliable.
• Improved installation of RPM Speed and RPM Cadence sensors.
• Improved speed sensor failover to GPS.
• Added Lap on Stop advanced setting, which causes a lap to be recorded on every manual stop. Turn it on to see markers for every time you tapped Stop on that workout.
• Improved reliability of Apple Watch app during connectivity interruptions.
• Updated online Workout Explorer so that elevation graph is no longer zero-based, and added distance and time to scrubbing display.
• Fixed issue in zone calculation affecting zone averages.
• Fixed issue with step cadence announcement in Japanese.
• Fixed issue with More > Pedometer sometimes being off by a day.
• Other bug fixes and improvements. Recommended for all users.

Updated for iOS 10 and watchOS 3!

• Improved performance and reliability with watchOS 3. Stats are updated in the background, and quickly update after you raise your wrist. Heart rate data synchronized every few seconds. Heart rate target alerts are now supported!
• Updated for iOS 10. Includes transport security for more secure online connections and improvements for full compatibility for iOS 10, iOS 9, and iOS 8.

Updated for iOS 10 and watchOS 3!

• Improved performance and reliability with watchOS 3. Stats are updated in the background, and quickly update after you raise your wrist. Heart rate data synchronized every few seconds. Heart rate target alerts are now supported!
• Updated for iOS 10. Includes transport security for more secure online connections and improvements for full compatibility for iOS 10, iOS 9, and iOS 8.

• Fixed an issue with iCloud backups under iOS 10.
• Fixed an issue with imports from RideWithGPS having bad elevation values.
• Improved contrast of our Today widget under iOS 10.
• Fixed compatibility issues under iOS 9 and 8 that could cause crashes.

If you use iCloud backup and the name of your device contains an apostrophe, for example "Morgan's iPhone", you may see two databases in More > iCloud: "Morgan%27s iPhone" and "Morgan's iPhone". If you need or want to install a database, you may install either database. The more recent one is at the top of the view and you can also check the dates. Versions 10.6 and 10.6.1 erroneously backed up your database to "Morgan%27s iPhone" but version 10.6.2 and all versions going forward will correctly backup your database to "Morgan's iPhone". You may install "Morgan%27s iPhone" or you may keep it for safekeeping, but when you no longer have use for "Morgan%27s iPhone", you may delete it. Again, version 10.6.2 and all versions going forward will correctly backup your database if it uses an apostrophe, for example "Morgan's iPhone”.

• Fixed an issue with iCloud backups under iOS 10.
• Fixed an issue with imports from RideWithGPS having bad elevation values.
• Improved contrast of our Today widget under iOS 10.
• Fixed compatibility issues under iOS 9 and 8 that could cause crashes.

If you use iCloud backup and the name of your device contains an apostrophe, for example "Morgan's iPhone", you may see two databases in More > iCloud: "Morgan%27s iPhone" and "Morgan's iPhone". If you need or want to install a database, you may install either database. The more recent one is at the top of the view and you can also check the dates. Versions 10.6 and 10.6.1 erroneously backed up your database to "Morgan%27s iPhone" but version 10.6.2 and all versions going forward will correctly backup your database to "Morgan's iPhone". You may install "Morgan%27s iPhone" or you may keep it for safekeeping, but when you no longer have use for "Morgan%27s iPhone", you may delete it. Again, version 10.6.2 and all versions going forward will correctly backup your database if it uses an apostrophe, for example "Morgan's iPhone”.

It is our 7th anniversary! Since 2009 we have shipped more than a 100 updates, incorporating feedback from our users and keeping our app on the leading edge. Here’s the latest.

• Added enhanced GPS error filtering.
• Changed Stop at End activity setting to rollback the end time for the workout.
• Improved Health authorization request for heart rate data.
• Fixed issue under iOS 10 when selecting a contact email address.

It is our 7th anniversary! Since 2009 we have shipped more than a 100 updates, incorporating feedback from our users and keeping our app on the leading edge. Here’s the latest.

• Added enhanced GPS error filtering.
• Changed Stop at End activity setting to rollback the end time for the workout.
• Improved Health authorization request for heart rate data.
• Fixed issue under iOS 10 when selecting a contact email address.

• Improved handling of heart rate data outages.
• Improved ability to use both an external HR monitor and Apple Watch.
• Improved import of indoor activities and step data.
• Improved ability to handle speed sensor errors by failing over to GPS.
• Added a setting to enable a speeds sensor only for indoor activities such as trainer workouts. See More > Devices > (bike speed sensor) > Bike Speed > Indoors Only.
• Added Background App Refresh permission to improve reliability when Location Services permission is set to “While Using”.

• Improved handling of heart rate data outages.
• Improved ability to use both an external HR monitor and Apple Watch.
• Improved import of indoor activities and step data.
• Improved ability to handle speed sensor errors by failing over to GPS.
• Added a setting to enable a speeds sensor only for indoor activities such as trainer workouts. See More > Devices > (bike speed sensor) > Bike Speed > Indoors Only.
• Added Background App Refresh permission to improve reliability when Location Services permission is set to “While Using”.

• Changes to pace calculations on start to avoid spike in pace graphs.
• Bug fixes and performance improvements.

• Changes to pace calculations on start to avoid spike in pace graphs.
• Bug fixes and performance improvements.

• Improved device support
- New pairing UI simultaneously shows all devices available for pairing.
- Live updates during pairing help select correct device.
- Can change order of devices to prioritize devices.
- Shows Battery Level.
- Shows Signal Strength.
- Shows firmware update availability.
• Improved power meter support
- Support for left & right power meters such as the PowerTap P1 pedals.
- Added Power Mode setting for Left, Right, Total power contribution.
- Added Scale setting for scaling power contribution.
- Tracks left/right Balance throughout workout.
- Includes Balance in FIT export.
- Added statistics support for Power Output (kJ).
• Fast switching between sensors of the same type. Don't have to wait for disconnection.
• Updated Power Statistic page to include Balance and Power Output (kJ). (Add page to see changes.)

• Improved device support
- New pairing UI simultaneously shows all devices available for pairing.
- Live updates during pairing help select correct device.
- Can change order of devices to prioritize devices.
- Shows Battery Level.
- Shows Signal Strength.
- Shows firmware update availability.
• Improved power meter support
- Support for left & right power meters such as the PowerTap P1 pedals.
- Added Power Mode setting for Left, Right, Total power contribution.
- Added Scale setting for scaling power contribution.
- Tracks left/right Balance throughout workout.
- Includes Balance in FIT export.
- Added statistics support for Power Output (kJ).
• Fast switching between sensors of the same type. Don't have to wait for disconnection.
• Updated Power Statistic page to include Balance and Power Output (kJ). (Add page to see changes.)

Welcome to our update for iOS 11 and watchOS 4!

• Now supports Siri for starting, pausing, and resuming workouts.
- Choose your activity and route in our iPhone app.
- Lock and stow away your iPhone.
- Press and hold your earphone remote to activate Siri.
- Say one of the following phrases:
"Start my workout with Cyclemeter."
"Pause my workout with Cyclemeter."
"Resume my workout with Cyclemeter."
- When your workout is complete, tap Done in our iPhone app to complete the workout.
• Apple Watch app updates:
- Pressing the digital crown and side buttons when our app is on screen starts and stops
your workouts. May be changed to signal a lap or announcement.
- Now starts heart rate monitoring when on screen, ahead of tapping Start.
• Supports FIT 2.0 import.
• New and simpler icons and launch images.
• Updated all library and subsystems to latest versions.

Apple Watch: Added a Workout Only switch for the Apple Watch heart rate monitor. When the Workout Only switch is turned on the heart rate monitor is only used when recording your workout. Turning the Workout Only switch on provides more stability for and is recommended for use with the 1st generation Apple Watch. Note that Crown / Button Press is unavailable when the Workout Only switch is turned on. To use Crown / Button Press please turn the Heart Rate switch on and the Workout Only switch off.

Apple Watch: Added a Workout Only switch for the Apple Watch heart rate monitor. When the Workout Only switch is turned on the heart rate monitor is only used when recording your workout. Turning the Workout Only switch on provides more stability for and is recommended for use with the 1st generation Apple Watch. Note that Crown / Button Press is unavailable when the Workout Only switch is turned on. To use Crown / Button Press please turn the Heart Rate switch on and the Workout Only switch off.

Updated for iPhone X!

We constantly improve Cyclemeter to give you a great workout experience, and have released hundreds of updates over our nine year history. Please send feedback and issues to support@abvio.com. Also, please do us the favor of rating and reviewing our app in the store. Thank you!

• Shows an indicator on Apple Watch app when communications between Apple Watch and iPhone are interrupted.

• Added ability to mass export your data at More > Settings > Advanced > Export Workouts. Use the iOS File app to transfer the zip file of workouts.
• In support of the EU GDPR, we updated our Terms and Conditions and Privacy Policy, which may be viewed at abvio.com/terms and abvio.com/privacy.
• Removed Register ability. Support info moved to Settings > Advanced.
• Added a fix for the Magene speed and cadence sensor.

• Facebook is removing the ability for apps to post on behalf of users, so we updated our app to show the Facebook sharing page on completion of a workout or when a workout is later shared. The Facebook sharing page includes a link to your online workout with statistics, and allows you to include a comment.
• Updated TCX & GPX export to signal when barometric altimeter data is included.
• Added Draw Smooth Paths option to Map Settings.

• New feature: Import from Health. This enables Apple Watch users to use the Workout app to track standalone workouts, and then later import them into our app. The first time, use More > Apple Watch > Import from Health or the menu in the History tab. Thereafter, our app will prompt you when it sees new workouts to import. Import from Health can also be used to import from other apps that post workouts to Health.
• Updated to use iOS subscriptions.
• Bug fixes.

New feature: Support for iOS Dark Mode!

Besides looking sleek, Dark Mode reduces battery consumption because OLED displays use less power when dark. If your iPhone is set to Dark Mode, our app will automatically display in Dark Mode. Or, in our app go to More > Settings > Stopwatch > Background to choose a setting different from your iPhone setting.

New feature: Trimming the end of workouts. Useful for those times where you forgot to tap Stop at the end of a ride, run, or walk! Visit the info page for the workout, and tap Trim.

Please stay safe with your family and communities.

If you're a podcast listener, this update is for you. We improved the way we handle audio so that if you're listening to spoken audio, our announcements interrupt the audio, instead of playing over the audio.

Plus a few bug fixes and other improvements.

If you're a podcast listener, this update is for you. We improved the way we handle audio so that if you're listening to spoken audio, our announcements interrupt the audio, instead of playing over the audio.

Plus a few bug fixes and other improvements.

Added a switch for Interrupt Spoken Audio in More > Settings > Announcements.

We also added an early look at our new support for Siri. Check it out at More > Siri and if you have any questions or feedback write to us at support@abvio.com.

Added a switch for Interrupt Spoken Audio in More > Settings > Announcements.

We also added an early look at our new support for Siri. Check it out at More > Siri and if you have any questions or feedback write to us at support@abvio.com.

Added an option to Announcements to mix other audio. If Interrupt Spoken Audio is not working with your podcast app, try using one of the other options. See More > Settings > Announcements > Other Audio.

Added an option to Announcements to mix other audio. If Interrupt Spoken Audio is not working with your podcast app, try using one of the other options. See More > Settings > Announcements > Other Audio.

Announcing two new features!

Friends - Free Live-Tracking and Messaging
• Automatically share your workout location, path, and statistics with family and friends.
• Messages are automatically spoken to you with text-to-speech.
• For safety and encouragement.
• See More > Friends.

Siri - Hands-free Control
• Use Siri to start, stop, and lap.
• Use Siri to ask for statistics like heart rate or distance.
• Note: you must enable Siri control before use.
• See More > Siri.

- Removed automated Facebook posting for improved privacy.

- Enabled iCloud backup by default to help assure your data is preserved, even if your iPhone is lost or our app is deleted.

- Enabled iCloud backup by default to help assure your data is preserved, even if your iPhone is lost or our app is deleted.
- Bug fixes and other improvements.

Now Cyclemeter can record workouts on your Apple Watch!

Two modes are supported, which are available in the settings of our Apple Watch app:

• Record on Apple Watch - your workouts are recorded on Apple Watch, and automatically transfered to your workout history when you open our iOS app. You do not need to take your iPhone with you. If your Apple Watch has cell access or your iPhone is nearby, you can live track using Friends, send Email Updates, use Siri to control workouts, and much more.

• Record on iPhone - same as before, you can use your Apple Watch to control recording on your iPhone. You need to take your iPhone with you on your workouts in this mode.

Our Apple Watch app is built using the same code that records workouts on iPhone, so it supports everything our iPhone app does, including announcements, target alerts, splits, intervals, laps, stop detection, and more. It does not yet support speed sensors, cadence sensors, power meters, or external heart rate monitors, but will in a future update.

If you have any questions, please write to us at support@abvio.com.

• Added support for power balance for the Assioma Favero power meter.
• Fixes and other improvements.

Welcome to the latest update of Cyclemeter. We constantly improve Cyclemeter to give you a great workout experience, and have released hundreds of updates over our ten year history. Please send feedback and issues to support@abvio.com. Also, please do us the favor of rating and reviewing our app in the store. Thank you!
